If nothing's broken, you can use hyperedit's land function to put it X distance above the surface, and rotate it back into position. From there, either land it yourself or let the mod do it for you.

You could use pod torque and/or RCS and/or fiddling with the legs to get it upright again without cheating.

I don't recommend it; I tried that back in .20 when something fell over onto it's side, and messing with it actually made things WORSE, and caused it to end up perfectly upside-down.

I think .21 had the mun eat it.
I'd say RCS and probe torque to try and upright it if you want to keep it; widen and shorten the stack if you want to try again.
